summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Board of Adjustment (Panel B) of Dallas, Texas, will convene on November 15, 2023, with a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall and via videoconference. The purpose is to discuss various zoning cases, hear public testimony, and approve minutes from previous meetings.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes staff presentations, public hearings, and miscellaneous items such as the approval of minutes from prior meetings. The Board will review uncontested cases, holdover items, and individual cases requiring decisions.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include requests for variances to front yard setback and building height regulations, special exceptions to landscaping and fence height regulations, and an application for an additional electrical meter. Notable cases include BDA223-092 for variances at 2851 W. Jefferson Boulevard and BDA223-098 for exceptions at 4104 Saranac Drive.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is seeking approval for the minutes from the special call meeting on October 31, 2023, and the Panel B meeting on October 18, 2023. Additionally, decisions will be made on the various applications presented, including variances and special exceptions outlined in the case docket. Public testimony will also be taken into account for these decisions.
